title: Advantage
excerpt: When you have advantage on a d20 roll, you roll two d20s and use the higher result. Advantage and disadvantage cancel each other out.
markdown:
# Advantage

Sometimes a special ability or spell tells you that you have advantage on a d20 roll. When that happens, you roll a second d20 when you make the roll. Use the higher of the two rolls.

## Rules

- If multiple situations affect a roll and each one grants advantage, you still roll only **one** additional d20
- If you have both advantage and [[disadvantage]], you roll only one d20-they cancel each other out, even if you have multiple sources of advantage or disadvantage

## Common Sources

### Attack Rolls
- Attacking a target you can't see gives the target advantage on the attack roll
- Attacking from hiding gives you advantage
- Attacking a prone target from within 5 feet gives you advantage
- Using the Help action gives an ally advantage on their next attack

### Ability Checks
- Taking the Dodge action gives attackers disadvantage, and you get advantage on Dexterity saving throws
- Some spells grant advantage (like *Enhance Ability*, *Guidance*, *Bless*)
- Working together (Help action) grants advantage

### Saving Throws
- Being prone gives you advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see
- Some class features grant advantage on specific saving throws
